Method Detail

getDesktopLocation

public static java.awt.Point getDesktopLocation(java.awt.Dimension windowSize)
getDesktopLocation returns a screen location, as a Ljava.awt.Point object, to position the frame of an application on the user's desktop of the windows environment (OS). Note that the positions signifies the top left corner of the frame.
Parameters:
windowSize - is a Ljava.awt.Dimension object specifying the size of the application frame.
Returns:
a Ljava.awt.Point location in the desktop environement (screen) to position the application frame.

getDialogLocation

public static java.awt.Point getDialogLocation(java.awt.Container frame,
                                               java.awt.Dimension dialogSize)
getDialogLocation returns a screen location, as a Ljava.awt.Point object, to position the dialog centered within the application frame that spawned the dialog box.
Parameters:
frame - is a Ljava.awt.Container object referencing the parent frame to the dialog box, for which the dialog box will be centered about.
dialogSize - is a Ljava.awt.Dimension object specifying the width and height of the dialog box.
Returns:
a Ljava.awt.Point location in the desktop environment (screen) that centers the dialog box about it's parent frame.
